bitfield.description: Active Safety Features [ASF] Configuration: 0 = None; 1 = Full ASF.
SP_HS_FIFO_DEPTH : HS FIFO depth in sending path.
SP_LP_FIFO_DEPTH : LP FIFO depth in sending path.
VRS_FIFO_DEPTH : FIFO depth in the VRS block.
Direct Command FIFO Depth [2:0]. Depth in bytes = 2^[value+2]
SDI interface data width: 0 = 16 bit, 1 = 32bit
Internal Datapath.width 00 - 32 bit, 01 - 16bit, 11 - 8 Bits.
Max Number of SDI interfaces [1-4] = [value+1]
Max Number of Lanes [1-4] = [value+1]
RX FIFO Depth [5:0]
TE_MIPI_POLLING_EN: enables TE Polling feature following MIPI recommendations [polling by software]
TE_HW_POLLING_EN: enables TE Polling feature following internal solution
DISP_EOT_GEN: display adds an EOT packet to its LPDT transfers
HOST_EOT_GEN: generates or not the EOT packet after a transfer in HS.
DISP_GEN_CHECKSUM: display generates checksum on its response packets.
DISP_GEN_ECC: display generates ECC on its response packets
BTA_EN: enables BTA
READ_EN: enables read operation
REG_TE_EN: enables Tearing Effect from register
SPLIT_PANEL_MODE: when enabled, DSC stage controls data for split panel signle DPHY link
IF3_TE_EN: enables Tearing Effect on interface 3. Note TE on all SDI interfaces is not supported and should be avoided
IF1_TE_EN: enables Tearing Effect on interface 1. Note TE on all SDI interfaces is not supported and should be avoided
TVG_SEL: Test Video Generator is enabled [it is not the start signal!] - should not be set if if1_en = 1 and if1_mode = 1 [see MCTL_MAIN_EN register ]
VID_EN: enables the video stream generator
VID_IF_SELECT: Determines which video interface is active [00 : SDI , 01 : DPI, 10 : DSC]
SDI_IF_VID_MODE:1: selected interface is in video mode, 0: selected interface is in command mode]
LINK_EN: enables [or not] the link]
HS_SKEWCAL_TIMEOUT_EN: Activate the HS SkewCal Control to occur after a timeout.
HS_SKEWCAL_FORCE_EN: Force the HS SkewCal Control to occur immediately
HS_SKEWCAL_EN: activate the HS SkewCal Control at start of HS Transmission
HS_INVERT_DAT4: invert HS signal on data lane 4
SWAP_PINS_DAT4: swap pins on clock lane 4
HS_INVERT_DAT3: invert HS signal on data lane 3
SWAP_PINS_DAT3: swap pins on clock lane 3
HS_INVERT_DAT2: invert HS signal on data lane 2
SWAP_PINS_DAT2: swap pins on clock lane 2
HS_INVERT_DAT1: invert HS signal on data lane 1
SWAP_PINS_DAT1: swap pins on data lane 1
HS_INVERT_CLK: invert HS signal on clock lane
SWAP_PINS_CLK: swap pins on clock lane
WAIT_BURST_TIME: delay to respect between two HS bursts. Value 0 is forbidden
DAT4_ULPM_EN: data lane 4 can be switched in ULP mode
DAT3_ULPM_EN: data lane 3 can be switched in ULP mode
DAT2_ULPM_EN: data lane 2 can be switched in ULP mode
DAT1_ULPM_EN: data lane 1 can be switched in ULP mode
CLK_ULPM_EN: specifies that clock lane can be switched in ULP mode [on demand]
CLK_CONTINUOUS: clock lane should remain in HS sending mode [no return in STOP state]
LANE4_EN: enables the fourth lane [ controls DCB FSM]
LANE3_EN: enables the third lane [ controls DCB FSM]
LANE2_EN: enables the second lane [ controls DCB FSM]
FORCE_STOP_MODE: when enabled, data lanes are forced back in STOP mode - this value should remain asserted for 10 us minimum
CLK_FORCE_STOP : force clock lanes back in STOP mode - this value should remain asserted for 10 us minimum
IF3_EN: enables DSC interface [i.e. removes stall signal]
IF2_EN: enables DPI interface [i.e. removes stall signal]
IF1_EN: enables SDI interface [i.e. removes stall signal]
DAT4_ULPM_REQ: switches data lane 4 in ULP mode
DAT3_ULPM_REQ: switches data lane 3 in ULP mode
DAT2_ULPM_REQ: switches data lane 2 in ULP mode
DAT1_ULPM_REQ: switches data lane 1 in ULP mode
CLKLANE_ULPM_REQ: switches clock lane in ULP mode
DAT4_EN: 1: starts data lane 4 [FSM data lane 4 is stuck in start mode if 0]
DAT3_EN: 1: starts data lane 3 [FSM data lane 3 is stuck in start mode if 0]
DAT2_EN: 1: starts data lane 2 [FSM data lane 2 is stuck in start mode if 0]
DAT1_EN: 1: starts data lane 1 [FSM data lane 1 is stuck in start mode if 0]
CKLANE_EN: 1: starts the clock lane
PLL_START: enables the PLL [when set, the PLL is started]
Drives dphy_c_rstb output
Drives dphy_d_rstb output
Drives dphy_pll_pdn output
Drives dphy_cmn_pdn output
Drives dphy_c_pdn output
Drives dphy_d_pdn output
Drives dphy_pll_pso output
Drives dphy_cmn_pso output
HSTX_TO_VAL: HS TX time-out detection value
CLK_DIV: clock division ratio
LPRX_TO_VAL: LP RX time-out detection value
DATA_ULPOUT_TIME: specify what the duration is to leave ULP mode is [for data lane[s] in system clock cycles
CKLANE_ULPOUT_TIME: specify what the duration is to leave ULP mode is [for clock lane] in system clock cycles
VID_VSYNC_3D_EN: Enable 3D Control this selects the 3D operation for VSYNC and video data control
VID_VSYNC_3D_LR: When 3D mode is enabled, this allows to choose which field to start the video stream '0' - Data is sent Left first then right '1' - Data is sent Right first then left

VID_VSYNC_3D_SECOND_EN: When 3D mode is enabled, this allows to choose if a second VSYNC is enabled between L and R images '0' - No sync pulses between left and right data '1' - Sync pulse [HSYNC, VSYNC, Blanking] between left and right image data

VID_VSYNC_3DFORMAT: video 3D Format for VSYNC Control Parameter1 '00' - Line Format, alternating line of left and right data '01' - Frame Format, alternating frames of left and right data '10' - Pixel Format, alternating pixels of left and right data '11' - Reserved
VID_VSYNC_3DMODE: video 3D mode for VSYNC Control Parameter1 '00' - 3D mode Off - 2D Mode only '01' - 3D On - Portrait Orientation '10' - 3D On - Landscape Orientation '11' - Reserved
HS_SKEWCAL_DONE: HS SkewCal Control Done at start of HS Transmission
IF3_UNTERM_PCK: Indicates an unterminated packet on DSC interface
IF2_UNTERM_PCK: Indicates an unterminated packet on DPI interface
IF1_UNTERM_PCK: Indicates an unterminated packet on SDI Interface
LPRX_TO_ERR: Indicates an LP_RX time-out error
HSTX_TO_ERR: Indicates an HS_TX time-out error
DAT4_READY: Indicates data lane 4 is ready
DAT3_READY: Indicates data lane 3 is ready
DAT2_READY: Indicates data lane 2 is ready
DAT1_READY: Indicates data lane 1 is ready
CLKLANE_READY: Indicates the clock lane is ready [normal DSI operation can start]
PLL_LCK: Indicates PLL is locked - data coming from DCB [if DSI link is PLL master] or copy of pll_en [if DSI link is slave]
Value of ppi_c_tx_ready_hs input
Value of dphy_pll_lock input
Value of ppi_d_rx_ulps_esc input
DATLANE4_STATE: state of the data lane 4 [00: start / 01: idle / 10: write / 11: ULPM]
DATLANE3_STATE: state of the data lane 3 [00: start / 01: idle / 10: write / 11: ULPM]
DATLANE2_STATE: state of the data lane 2 [00: start / 01: idle / 10: write / 11: ULPM]
DATLANE1_STATE: state of the data lane 1 [000: start / 001: idle / 010: write / 011: ULPM / 100: read]
CLKLANE_STATE: state of the clock lane [00: start / 01: idle / 10: HS / 11: ULPM]
Enable DSC Mode Controls
Send PPS Command and Payload to the display
Send Execute Queue Command to Synchonise the display drivers
WRDAT3: 4th byte to be sent as part of PPS payload [stored in a FIFO]
WRDAT2: 3rd byte to be sent as part of PPS payload [stored in a FIFO]
WRDAT1: 2nd byte to be sent as part of PPS payload [stored in a FIFO]
WRDAT0: 1st byte to be sent as part of PPS payload [stored in a FIFO]
DSC PPS Command Sent
DSC Execute Command Sent
SKEWCAL_TO_VAL: Timeout value
IF3_LP_EN: enable to send command from DSC interface in LP if possible
IF1_LP_EN: enable to send command from SDI interface in LP if possible
IF3_ID: Virtual Channel ID of request from DSC interface command
IF1_ID: Virtual Channel ID of request from SDI interface command
TE_TIMEOUT : on TE request - length of TE response window before timeout.
FIL_VALUE: value to use to fill packet during data underrun or to complete unterminated packet [referred as padding value]
ARB_PRI: in fixed mode, specify interface with higher priority SDI 01, DSC 10
ARB_MODE: arbitration mode [1: round robin, 0: fixed]
ERR_IF1_UNDERRUN: Indicates a data shortage occurs on IF1
ERR_UNWANTED_RD: Indicates a read request was received while read capability was not enabled
ERR_TE_MISS: error: TE window time-out
ERR_NO_TE: error: no TE generated by display
CSM_RUNNING: Indicates CSM is running - command[s] are being proceeded
Initiate the direct command send operation
TRIGGER_VAL: trigger value if trigger request [see Note about trigger mapping] - signal is one hot encoding [only one bit out of the 4 should be set to 1].
CMD_LP_EN: enables LP sending for the command request

CMD_SIZE: size, in bytes, of the command payload. Note that the value written here by software should comply with certain limits. For write operations, any value written which is larger than the FIFO depth [direct_cmd_fifodepth parameter] will be ignored and the command payload will be truncated to the maximum FIFO depth. For read operations, any value written which is larger than 2 bytes will be ignored and the command payload will be truncated to 2 bytes.
CMD_ID: For a read/write command, Virtual Channel of the command
CMD_HEAD: For a read/write command, datatype of the command
CMD_LONGNOTSHORT: Tie this to '1' if a long packet has to be generated.
CMD_NAT: Type of the direct command: 000: write command 001: read command 100: TE request 101: trigger request 110: BTA request
ACK_VAL: if an acknowledge with error has been received, this field reports its value
TRIGGER_VAL: if a trigger has been received, this field reports its value - refer to Note regarding trigger mapping
READ_COMPLETED_WITH_ERR: read command terminated with error
BTA_FINISHED: DSI link recovered link master role after a BTA request
BTA_COMPLETED: indicates that BTA request completed
TE_RECEIVED: TE received
TRIGGER_RECEIVED: If command with BTA, this bit is set if an trigger was received
ACKNOWLEDGE_WITH_ERR_RECEIVED: If command with BTA, this bit is set if an acknowledge with error was received
ACKNOWLEDGE_RECEIVED: If command with BTA, this bit is set if an acknowledge with no error was received
READ_COMPLETED: read command request completed
TRIGGER_COMPLETED: trigger command request completed
WRITE_COMPLETED: write command request completed
CMD_TRANSMISSION: a command is being sent
Stop Read Operation
WRDAT3: 4th byte to be sent as part of Direct Command [stored in a FIFO]
WRDAT2: 3rd byte to be sent as part of Direct Command [stored in a FIFO]
WRDAT1: 2nd byte to be sent as part of Direct Command [stored in a FIFO]
WRDAT0: 1st byte to be sent as part of Direct Command [stored in a FIFO]
Direct Command FIFO Reset
RDDAT3: 4th byte from incoming Direct Command receive path
RDDAT2: 3rd byte from incoming Direct Command receive path
RDDAT1: 2nd byte from incoming Direct Command receive path
RDDAT0: 1st byte from incoming Direct Command receive path
RD_DCSNOTGENERIC: Type of read command [DCS or generic]
RD_ID: Virtual channel of the read received
RD_SIZE: Size of the read data received
ERR_EOT_WITH_ERR: EOT received with error
ERR_MISSING_EOT: EOT requested but not received

ERR_WRONG_LENGTH : length error has been detected. This error indicates that a packet has been received which was shorter than the expected length [longer packets than expected will result in ERR_RECEIVE field being set, as it is difficult to distinguish the extra information from other types of reception errors].
ERR_OVERSIZE : packet size exceeds maximum

ERR_RECEIVE : received packet not complete. This is a general error flag indicated that packet reception did not complete for some reason. Example conditions: signalling errors [e.g. unexpected change in PPI direction signal]; longer packet received than expected.
ERR_UNDECODABLE : command opcode not understood
ERR_CHECKSUM: error[s] detected by checksum
ERR_UNCORRECTABLE : more than 1 error detected by ECC
ERR_FIXED : one error detected and fixed by ECC
VID_IGNORE_MISSING_SYNC: When mode is enabled, this allows the video stream to go to IDLE during VFP and wait for new VSYNC without link failing to recovery
RECOVERY_MODE: specify recovery mode
REG_BLKEOL_MODE: behavior during end of line in burst mode - same coding as reg_blkline_mode
REG_BLKLINE_MODE : behavior during blanking time [1x: LP, 01: blanking packet - 00: NULL packet]
SYNC_PULSE_HORIZONTAL: syncs are pulse [1] or event [0] all the time [DSI protocol v1.00..._r6 and later] - to be set only when sync_pulse_active = 1
SYNC_PULSE_ACTIVE: syncs are pulse [1] or event [0] during active area [DSI protocol v1.00..._r3 and before]
BURST_MODE: signals if system works in burst mode or not

VID_PIXEL_MODE: 0000: 16 bits RGB - 0001: 18 bits RGB 0010: 18 bits RGB[loose] - 0011: 24 bits RGB 0100: 30 bits RGB - 0101: 36 bits RGB 1000: 12 bits YCbCr - 1001: 16 bits YCbCr 1010: 20 bits YCbCr - 1011: 24 bits YCbCr 1100: DSC Compressed
HEADER : specify the datatype of RGB packets
VID_ID : specify the Virtual Channel Identifier of the video packets

STOP_MODE : video stop point [see description in Video Stream Generator [VSG] section] .[The configurations where the frame stops at the end of any line and at the end of the last active line - start_mode in [1;2] - are being deprecated, thus not verified anymore

START_MODE: video entry point [see description in Video Stream Generator [VSG] section][The configuration where the frame starts with a VFP - start_mode=1 - is being deprecated, thus not verified anymore]
VFP_LENGTH: length of the VFP [in lines]
VBP_LENGTH: length of the VBP [in lines]
VSA_LENGTH: duration of the VSYNC pulse [in lines]
VACT_LENGTH: vertical length of active area [in line]
HBP_LENGTH: length of HBP [in bytes] - if 0, HBP packet is sent with 0 payload
HSA_LENGTH: duration of HSYNC pulse [in bytes]
HFP_LENGTH: length of HFP [in bytes] - if 0, no HFP packet is sent
RGB_SIZE: size [in byte] of the RGB packet
BLKEOL_PCK: packet length [in byte] on end of line if burst mode [reg_blkeol_mode = 0b0x]

BLKLINE_EVENT_PCK: packet length [in byte] in blanking line if line has to be filled with a packet [reg_blkline_mode = 0b0x] and sync is an event Event mode Blank line |_____|________________________________blkline_event_pck___________________________| |_HSS_|HDR______________________________________________________________________CRC|_HSS_

BLKLINE_PULSE_PCK: packet length in blanking line if line has to be filled with a packet [reg_blkline_mode = 0b0x] and sync is a pulse Pulse mode Blank line |_____________ |_______________________blkline_pulse_pck___________________________| |_HSS_HSA_HSE__|HDR_____________________________________________________________CRC|_HSS_
BLKEOL_DURATION: specify the duration in clock cycles of the BLLP period [used for burst mode]

REG_WAKEUP_TIME: estimated time [in clock cycles] to perform LP->HS on D-PHY |___________reg_wakeup_time________________| | Clk Request |------------>| Clk Ready | Data Request |-------------------> | Data Ready
COL_GREEN: green component of the fill color
COL_RED: red component of the fill color
PAD_VALUE: byte used to pad data [when system does not know exactly where it is]
COL_BLUE: blue component of the fill color
LINE_VAL: line number of the current area
LINE_POS: position in the frame [see description in Video Stream Generator]
HORIZONTAL_VAL: position in the current horizontal area [in clock cycles]
HORIZONTAL_POS: position in the line [see description in Video Stream Generator]
VSG_RECOVERY: specifies whether the VSG is in recovery mode or not
ERR_VRS_WRONG_LENGTH: signals that packets in SDI interface differ from the expected size [as specified by rgb_size]
ERR_LONGREAD: signals the read was too long
ERR_LINEWRITE: signals the long packet is too long to pass during a long slot
ERR_BURSTWRITE: signals a long packet has been sent during active area
REG_ERR_SMALL_HEIGHT: fewer lines than expected between 2 VSYNC
REG_ERR_SMALL_LENGTH: fewer bytes received than expected between 2 HSYNC. Note that MISSING_DATA error may occur instead of SMALL_LENGTH, dependent upon timing.
ERR_MISSING_VSYNC: missing VSYNC
ERR_MISSING_HSYNC: missing HSYNC
ERR_MISSING_DATA: data starvation at input of the VSG. Note that this error report may also be triggered instead of the SMALL_LENGTH error, dependent upon timing.
VSG_RUNNING: VSG is running [1] or stopped [0]
BURST_LP: after an active line, the system can switch in LP [1] or should complete the line with NULL packet [0]
MAX_BURST_LIMIT: size of the 'biggest' burst packet [packet that fits after RGB in burst mode]
MAX_LINE_LIMIT: maximum size of the line packet [packet that fits in blanking line]
EXACT_BURST_LIMIT: exact maximum size of the burst packet [packet that fits after RGB in burst mode]
TVG_STRIPE_SIZE: size of the stripe [in pixels] - defined by 2^reg_tvg_stripe_size
TVG_MODE: TVG display mode : 00 : single color ; 01 : reserved ; 10 : vertical stripes ; 11 horizontal stripes
TVG_STOPMODE: stop mode: 00: at end of frame, 01: at end of line, 1x: immediate
TVG_RUN: start/stop of the TVG
TVG_NBLINE: Number of lines per frame
TVG_LINE_SIZE: Number of bytes per line
COL1_GREEN: green component of the color 1
COL1_RED: red component of the color 1
COL1_BLUE: blue component of the color 1
COL2_GREEN: green component of the color 2
COL2_RED: red component of the color 2
COL2_BLUE: blue component of the color 2
TVG_RUNNING: status of the TVG
IF3_UNTERM_PCK_ERR_EDGE: edge detection of if3_unterm_pck_err
IF1_UNTERM_PCK_ERR_EDGE: edge detection of if1_unterm_pck_err
LPRX_TO_ERR_EDGE: edge detection of LP_RX time-out error
HSTX_TO_ERR_EDGE: edge detection of HS_TX time-out error
DAT4_READY_EDGE: edge detection of dat4_ready
DAT3_READY_EDGE: edge detection of dat3_ready
DAT2_READY_EDGE: edge detection of dat2_ready
DAT1_READY_EDGE: edge detection of dat1_ready
CLKLANE_READY_EDGE: edge detection of clklane_ready
PLL_LOCK_EDGE: edge detection of PLL lock
IF3_UNTERM_PCK_ERR_EN: enables if3_unterm_pck_err
IF1_UNTERM_PCK_ERR_EN: enables if1_unterm_pck_err
LPRX_TO_ERR_EN: enables lprx_to_err
HSTX_TO_ERR_EN: enables hstx_to_err
DAT4_READY_EN: enables dat4_ready
DAT3_READY_EN: enables dat3_ready
DAT2_READY_EN: enables dat2_ready
DAT1_READY_EN: enables dat1_ready
CLKLANE_READY_EN: enables clklane_ready
PLL_LOCK_EN: enables PLL lock
ERR_IF3_UNDERRUN_EDGE: edge detection of err_IF3_underrun
ERR_IF1_UNDERRUN_EDGE: edge detection of err_IF1_underrun
ERR_UNWANTED_RD_EDGE: edge detection of err_unwanted_rd
ERR_TE_MISS_EDGE: edge detection of err_te_miss
ERR_NO_TE_EDGE: edge detection of err_no_te
CSM_RUNNING_EDGE: edge detection of CSM running
ERR_IF3_UNDERRUN_EN: enables err_IF3_underrun
ERR_IF1_UNDERRUN_EN: enables err_IF1_underrun
ERR_UNWANTED_RD_EN: enables err_unwanted_rd
ERR_TE_MISS_EN: enables err_te_miss
ERR_NO_TE_EN: enables err_no_te
CSM_RUNNING_EN: enables signaling of CSM running
READ_COMPLETED_WITH_ERR_EDGE: edge detection of read detection completed with errors
BTA_FINISHED_EDGE: edge detection of BTA completion detection
BTA_COMPLETED_EDGE: edge detection of BTA request completed
TE_RECEIVED_EDGE: edge detection of TE received
TRIGGER_RECEIVED_EDGE: edge detection of trigger
ACKNOWLEDGE_WITH_ERR_EDGE: edge detection of acknowledge with error
ACKNOWLEDGE_RECEIVED_EDGE: edge detection of acknowledge
READ_COMPLETED_EDGE: edge detection of read request completed
TRIGGER_COMPLETED_EDGE: edge detection of trigger request completed
WRITE_COMPLETED_EDGE: edge detection of detection of write request completed
CMD_TRANSMISSION_EDGE: edge detection of cmd_transmission
READ_COMPLETED_WITH_ERR_EN: enables detection of read completed with errors
BTA_FINISHED_EN: enables BTA completion detection
BTA_COMPLETED_EN: enables BTA request completed
TE_RECEIVED_EN: enables TE received
TRIGGER_RECEIVED_EN: enables trigger
ACKNOWLEDGE_WITH_ERR_EN: enables acknowledge with error
ACKNOWLEDGE_RECEIVED_EN: enables acknowledge
READ_COMPLETED_EN: enables read request completed
TRIGGER_COMPLETED_EN: enables trigger_completed
WRITE_COMPLETED_EN: enables write_completed
CMD_TRANSMISSION_EN: enables detection of cmd_transmission
ERR_EOT_WITH_ERR_EDGE: edge detection of err_eot_with_err
ERR_MISSING_EOT_EDGE: edge detection of err_missing_eot
ERR_WRONG_LENGTH_EDGE: edge detection of err_wrong_length
ERR_OVERSIZE_EDGE: edge detection of err_oversize
ERR_RECEIVE_EDGE: edge detection of err_receive
ERR_UNDECODABLE_EDGE: edge detection of err_undecodable
ERR_CHECKSUM_EDGE: edge detection of err_checksum
ERR_UNCORRECTABLE_EDGE: edge detection of err_uncorrectable
ERR_FIXED_EDGE: edge detection of err_fixed
ERR_EOT_WITH_ERR_EN: enables err_eot_with_err
ERR_MISSING_EOT_EN: enables err_missing_eot
ERR_WRONG_LENGTH_EN: enables err_wrong_length
ERR_OVERSIZE_EN: enables err_oversize
ERR_RECEIVE_EN: enables err_receive
ERR_UNDECODABLE_EN: enables err_undecodable
ERR_CHECKSUM_EN: enables err_checksum
ERR_UNCORRECTABLE_EN: enables err_uncorrectable
ERR_FIXED_EN: enables err_fixed
VSG_RECOVERY_EDGE: edge detection of vsg_recovery
ERR_VRS_WRONG_LENGTH_EDGE: edge detection of err_vrs_wrong_length
ERR_LONGREAD_EDGE: edge detection of err_longread
ERR_LINEWRITE_EDGE: edge detection of err_line_write
ERR_BURSTWRITE_EDGE: edge detection of err_burst_write
ERR_SMALL_HEIGHT_EDGE: edge detection of unaligned line number
ERR_SMALL_LENGTH_EDGE: edge detection of unaligned size
ERR_MISSING_VSYNC_EDGE: edge detection of detection of missing VSYNC
ERR_MISSING_HSYNC_EDGE: edge detection of detection of missing HSYNC
ERR_MISSING_DATA_EDGE: edge detection of data miss detection
VSG_RUNNING_EDGE: edge detection of VSG status observation
VSG_RECOVERY_EN: enables vsg_recovery
ERR_VRS_WRONG_LENGTH_EN: enables err_vrs_wrong_length
ERR_LONGREAD_EN: enables err_longread
ERR_LINEWRITE_EN: enables err_line_write
ERR_BURSTWRITE_EN: enables err_burst_write
ERR_SMALL_HEIGHT_EN: enables detection of unaligned line number
ERR_SMALL_LENGTH_EN: enables detection of unaligned size
ERR_MISSING_VSYNC_EN: enables detection of missing VSYNC
ERR_MISSING_HSYNC_EN: enables detection of missing HSYNC
ERR_MISSING_DATA_EN: enables data miss detection
VSG_RUNNING_EN: enables VSG status observation
TVG_STS_EDGE: edge detection of TVG status observation
TVG_STS_EN: enables TVG status observation
ERR_CONT_LP1_4_EN
ERR_CONT_LP1_3_EN
ERR_CONT_LP1_2_EN
ERR_CONT_LP1_1_EN
ERR_CONT_LP0_4_EN
ERR_CONT_LP0_3_EN
ERR_CONTROL_4_EN
ERR_CONTROL_3_EN
ERR_CONTROL_2_EN
ERR_CONTROL_1_EN
ERR_ESC_2_EN
ERR_ESC_1_EN
ERR_CONT_LP1_4_EDGE
ERR_CONT_LP0_4_EDGE
ERR_CONTROL_3_EDGE
ERR_ESC_3_EDGE
IF3_UNTERM_PCK_ERR_CLR: clears if3_unterm_pck_err
IF1_UNTERM_PCK_ERR_CLR: clears if1_unterm_pck_err
LPRX_TO_ERR_CLR: clears lprx_to_err
HSTX_TO_ERR_CLR: clears hstx_to_err
DAT4_READY_CLR: clears dat4_ready
DAT3_READY_CLR: clears dat3_ready
DAT2_READY_CLR: clears dat2_ready
DAT1_READY_CLR: clears dat1_ready
CLKLANE_READY_CLR: clears clklane_ready
PLL_LOCK_CLR: clears PLL lock
ERR_IF3_UNDERRUN_CLR: clears err_IF3_underrun
ERR_IF1_UNDERRUN_CLR: clears err_IF1_underrun
ERR_UNWANTED_RD_CLR: clears err_unwanted_rd
ERR_TE_MISS_CLR: clears err_te_miss
ERR_NO_TE_CLR: clears err_no_te
CSM_RUNNING_CLR: clears CSM running bit
READ_COMPLETED_WITH_ERR_CLR: clears detection of read completed with errors
BTA_FINISHED_CLR: clears BTA completion detection
BTA_COMPLETED_CLR: clears BTA request completed
TE_RECEIVED_CLR: clears TE received
TRIGGER_RECEIVED_CLR: clears trigger
ACKNOWLEDGE_WITH_ERR_CLR: clears acknowledge with errors
ACKNOWLEDGE_RECEIVED_CLR: clears acknowledge
READ_COMPLETED_CLR: clears read request completed
TRIGGER_COMPLETED_CLR: clears trigger request completed
WRITE_COMPLETED_CLR: clears detection of write request completed
CMD_TRANSMISSION_CLR: clears cmd_transmission
ERR_EOT_WITH_ERR_CLR: clears err_eot_with_err
ERR_MISSING_EOT_CLR: clears err_missing_eot
ERR_WRONG_LENGTH_CLR: clears err_wrong_length
ERR_OVERSIZE_CLR: clears err_oversize
ERR_RECEIVE_CLR: clears err_receive
ERR_UNDECODABLE_CLR: clears err_undecodable
ERR_CHECKSUM_CLR: clears err_checksum
ERR_UNCORRECTABLE_CLR: clears err_uncorrectable
ERR_FIXED_CLR: clears err_fixed
VSG_RECOVERY_CLR: clears the bit vsg_recovery
ERR_VRS_WRONG_LENGTH_CLR: clears the bit err_vid_wrong_length
ERR_LONGREAD_CLR: clears err_longread
ERR_LINEWRITE_CLR: clears err_linewrite
ERR_BURSTWRITE_CLR: clears err_burstwrite

Enable DPI FIFO Overflow interrupt

DPI FIFO depth - configuration paramter

Test status - Value of test_generic_status input
Test control - Drives test_generic_ctrl output
VENDOR_ID: IP vendor ID affected to CadenceIP [reset = 0xCAD].
PRODUCT_ID: unique IP identifier within IP portfolio [reset = 0xD5].
H: Hardware revision number [reset = 0x1].
X: Major revision value [reset = 0x3].
Y: Minor revision value [reset = 0x1].
